00024 // http://www.brainbell.com/tutorials/C++/Generating_Random_Numbers.htm
00025 typedef boost::mt19937 BaseGenerator;
00026 typedef boost::uniform_real<double> Distribution;
00027 typedef boost::variate_generator<BaseGenerator, Distribution> Generator;

00031 // =============================================================================
00033 double denorm(double value, double a, double b)
00034 {
00035     // need to handle value beyond 0 and 1
00036     // TODO: throw an exception class here?
00037     if (value < 0 || value > 1) 
00038         throw std::out_of_range("value must be between 0 and 1"); 
00039 
00040     // if no range, return boundary
00041     if (a == b) return a;
00042     // general form: value * (max - min) + max;
00043     // a is min, b is max
00044     else if (a < b) return (value * (b - a)) + a;
00045     // b is min, a is max
00046     else return (value * (a - b)) + b;   
00047 }

00053 double sampleTimeToSecondTime(long sampleTime, double sr)
00054 {
00055     // given a number of samples into the future, determine how manuy 
00056     // seconds this takes
00057     // simply divide by sampling reate
00058     return static_cast<double>(sampleTime) / sr;
00059 }
00060 
00061 
00062 
00063 // =============================================================================
00065 
00066 long secondTimeToSampleTime(double secondTime, double sr)
00067 {
00068     return static_cast<long>(secondTime * sr);
00069 }

00072 // =============================================================================
00074 double randUnit()
00075 {
00076     // this works but clearly does not seem to be the best way to do this
00077     // since these are static, however, it might be fine, as there is one
00078     // for all instances?
00079     static double const min = 0;
00080     static double const max = 1;
00081     static BaseGenerator base(std::time(0));
00082     static Distribution dist(min, max);
00083     static Generator rng(base, dist);
00084     return rng();
00085 
00086 }

00089 
00091 // based on Koenig, p135
00092 long randRange(long a, long b)
00093 {
00094     // for now, assume that a is min and b is max
00095     long shift = 0 - a; // get negative offset
00096     // long min = a + shift; // starts at zero now
00097     long max = b + shift; 
00098 
00099     // integer division truncates
00100     if (max > RAND_MAX) 
00101         throw std::domain_error("max randRange argument is out of range");
00102 
00103     const long bucketSize = RAND_MAX / max;
00104     long r;
00105 
00106     do r = std::rand() / bucketSize;
00107     while (r >= max);
00108 
00109     return r - shift; // restore shift value
00110 }

00115 // =============================================================================
00117 // we must provide a length argument
00118 void printArray (double arg[], long length, const std::string& header) 
00119 {
00120     std::vector<std::string> tokens; // for storage of string conversion
00121 
00122     // convert to a vector of strings
00123     for (long i=0; i<length; i++) {
00124         std::stringstream out;
00125         out << arg[i]; // adds to stream
00126         tokens.push_back(out.str()); 
00127     };
00128 
00129     // using boost::join, returns a string
00130     // return boost::join(tokens, " | ");
00131     std::cout << header << ": " << boost::join(tokens, " | ") << std::endl;
00132 }

00136 template <typename T>
00137 void printVector (const std::vector<T>& src, const std::string& header) 
00138 {
00139     std::vector<std::string> tokens; // for storage of string conversion
00140     typedef typename std::vector<T>::const_iterator IterType;
00141 
00142     // use a const_iterator to get values out of src
00143     // go from .begin to .end
00144     for (IterType iter = src.begin(); iter != src.end(); ++iter) {
00145         std::stringstream out;
00146         // w/o iterator, would be src[i]
00147         // if access a member of structure named 'name', would use (*iter).name
00148         // parens are req due to precedence of .
00149         // this is the same as iter->name
00150         out << *iter; 
00151         tokens.push_back(out.str()); 
00152     };
00153     // using boost::join, returns a string
00154     std::cout << header << ": " << boost::join(tokens, " | ") << std::endl;
00155 }
00156 // these are required for each class of the tempalte
00157 // necessary b/c of template definition in header: http://www.parashift.com/c++-faq-lite/templates.html#faq-35.13
00158 // solve linking errors by providing samples
00159 template void printVector<int> (const std::vector<int>& src, const std::string& header);
00160 template void printVector<long> (const std::vector<long>& src, const std::string& header);
00161 template void printVector<double> (const std::vector<double>& src, const std::string& header);
00162
